Message.Markdown: ### Library: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.JwtBearer
### Library: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.QuickGrid.EntityFrameworkAdapter
### Library: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.EntityFrameworkCore
### Library: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.UI
### Library: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore
### Library: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite
### Library: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer
### Library: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools
### Library: Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Design

Message.Text: Entity Framework Object Used as Controller Parameter
Message.Markdown: ### We found an Entity Framework object that was used as a binding object via controller parameter. This can lead to Overposting (or Mass Assignment) attacks where an attacker sends more data than the developer intends but the data is processed due to automatic data binding.

Message.Text: Entity Framework Object Used as Controller Parameter
Message.Markdown: ### We found an Entity Framework object that was used as a binding object via controller parameter. This can lead to Overposting (or Mass Assignment) attacks where an attacker sends more data than the developer intends but the data is processed due to automatic data binding.
### A Controller action was found without CSRF protection, such as a [ValidateAntiforgeryToken] attribute on either the Controller class or the Action method.
### A Controller action was found without CSRF protection, such as a [ValidateAntiforgeryToken] attribute on either the Controller class or the Action method.

Message.Text: Controller Action Is Missing Method Attribute
Message.Markdown: ### A Controller action was found without an attribute, such as [HttpGet] or [HttpPost], limiting the methods that could be used. If this endpoint is intended for methods without bodies (such as GETs) only this is likely not a security concern. If it is used for methods with bodies (such as POSTs or PUTs), this can be used to bypass CSRF checks.

Message.Text: Controller Action Parameters Missing Binding Info
Message.Markdown: ### A Controller action was found with parameters that are missing binding information attributes, such as [FromForm] or [FromBody]. When these attributes are missing, attackers can send information via channels that the developer didn't intend. This can be especially problematic if the method attribute is missing and an attacker can use the method (e.g. GET or POST) of their choice.

Message.Text: Internal JavaScript Used Without Integrity Hash
Message.Markdown: ### To help prevent malicious actors from tampering with JavaScript files, you should include an integrity hash on your script tag. This will allow the browser to block any scripts that have changed without your knowledge.

Message.Text: Internal JavaScript Used Without Integrity Hash

Message.Text: Internal CSS Link Missing Integrity Hash
Message.Markdown: ### When you link to CSS files, you should include an integrity hash to ensure that if the file was tampered with maliciously that it will not be loaded by the browser, ensuring that an attacker cannot use it to attack your users.

Message.Text: Internal CSS Link Missing Integrity Hash
Message.Markdown: ### When you link to CSS files, you should include an integrity hash to ensure that if the file was tampered with maliciously that it will not be loaded by the browser, ensuring that an attacker cannot use it to attack your users.

Message.Text: Internal CSS Link Missing Integrity Hash
Message.Markdown: ### When you link to CSS files, you should include an integrity hash to ensure that if the file was tampered with maliciously that it will not be loaded by the browser, ensuring that an attacker cannot use it to attack your users.

Message.Text: A Controller method is missing a call to ModelState.IsValid
Message.Markdown: ### By skipping a call to ModelState.IsValid, any input validation done on model objects may be missed and bad input may be processed by your system.

Message.Text: Login found with Lockout on Failure set to false
Message.Markdown: ### Attackers may try to guess passwords in a brute force attack. Setting lockoutOnFailure = true will reduce the likelihood that an attacker will get in.

Message.Text: An object implementing IUserStore was found, but the object did not also implement IUserLockoutStore

Message.Text: Cookie created with HttpOnly set to false
Message.Markdown: ### A cookie was appended to the HTTP Response and was configured so that HttpOnly was set to false. This setting allows JavaScript to access the cookie, potentially making the data available to hackers in a Cross-Site Scripting attack.

Message.Text: Cookie created with Secure set to false
Message.Markdown: ### A cookie was appended to the HTTP Response and was configured so that Secure was set to false. This setting allows the browser to send the cookie via HTTP (vs. HTTPS) requests, making it easier for this to be stolen via a Machine in the Middle attack.

Message.Text: Entity Framework Object Used as Razor Page [BindProperty]
Message.Markdown: ### We found an Entity Framework object that was used as a binding object in a razor page. This can lead to Overposting (or Mass Assignment) attacks where an attacker sends more data than the developer intends but the data is processed due to automatic data binding.

Message.Text: JWTs are configured without an expiration time
Message.Markdown: ### This eliminates the mandatory check for token expiration, making it possible for expired or revoked tokens to be accepted, leading to potential security vulnerabilities such as unauthorized access, data breaches, and reuse of invalidated tokens.

Message.Text: JWTs are configured so that token lifetimes are not validated
Message.Markdown: ### Setting token lifetimes limits the damage an attacker with a stolen token can do. If a token is stolen, an attacker may be able to use that token indefinitely.

Message.Text: JWTs configured to allow unsigned tokens
Message.Markdown: ### Setting this to false allows attackers to tamper or forge tokens, leading to unauthorized access and worse.

Message.Text: Possible Cross-Site Scripting - IHtmlHelper value from Controller parameter
Message.Markdown: ### The scanner found a property that originated from a Controller parameter was used in a call to an IHtmlHelper extension method. This likely results in a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability. Because the Controller method allows GETs, this may be used for phishing attempts in ways that POSTs (or similar) cannot be.

Message.Text: Possible Cross-Site Scripting - Html.Raw() value from Controller parameter
Message.Markdown: ### The scanner found a property that originated from a Controller parameter was used in a call to Html.Raw(). This likely results in a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability. Because the Controller method allows GETs, this may be used for phishing attempts in ways that POSTs (or similar) cannot be.
